article.title: Timeline: Sachin Tendulkar Youngest Recipient of The Bharat Ratna Award

content.value:
Legendary cricketer Sachin Tendulkar and eminent scientist C N R Rao were conferred the Bharat Ratna, India’s highest civilian award, by President Pranab Mukherjee at the Rashtrapati Bhavan on 4th February, 2014.

 

Sachin, who was nominated to the Rajya Sabha last year, became the youngest recipient and the first sports person to receive the award. He and Professor Rao join the elite list of 41 personalities to have received the award.

 

Sachin is also the recipient of Padma Vibhushan, the country’s second highest civilian honor.

 

The Bharat Ratna award was instituted in 1954, and is given in recognition of exceptional service or performance of the highest order in any field of human endeavour.

 

Some of the eminent personalities who have received the award include Pandit Bhimsen Joshi (2009), Ustad Bismillah Khan (2001) and Lata Mangeshkar (2001).
